skill.name: apple-mail
skill.description: Comprehensive guide for accessing and automating Apple Mail using AppleScript, including reading emails, sending messages, and managing mailboxes.
skill.summary: Comprehensive guide for accessing and automating Apple Mail using AppleScript, including reading ema...
skill.author: BfdCampos

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation-only guide containing AppleScript examples for automating Apple Mail. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond the skill's own directory. All functionality requires user to manually execute osascript commands with Apple Mail. Low risk due to documentation-only nature and explicit, transparent code examples.

content.value_statement: Manually searching, reading, and sending emails wastes time. This skill provides ready-to-use AppleScript examples so you can automate email workflows directly from Claude. Read, send, reply, search, and manage Apple Mail without switching apps.
actual_capabilities: List all configured mail accounts in Apple Mail
Read emails with full metadata from any account inbox
Send new emails programmatically with custom subject and body
Reply to emails while preserving thread context
Search emails by sender, subject, or content
Move, archive, or delete emails based on criteria
limitations: Works only with Apple Mail on macOS
Requires macOS privacy permission for Mail access
Does not support Gmail, Outlook, or other email clients
Cannot access encrypted or password-protected mailboxes

use_cases.title: Automated code review notifications
use_cases.description: Send automated emails to teammates when code is ready for review or CI tests complete.

use_cases.title: Batch email processing
use_cases.description: Search and archive emails from specific senders or with certain keywords automatically.

use_cases.title: Unread email monitoring
use_cases.description: Check unread message counts and get summaries of recent emails without opening Mail.

prompt_templates.title: List mail accounts
prompt_templates.prompt: List all the email accounts configured in my Apple Mail.

prompt_templates.title: Read recent emails
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the last 5 emails from my Gmail inbox in Apple Mail.

prompt_templates.title: Send email
prompt_templates.prompt: Send an email to team@example.com with subject 'Weekly Update' and body summarising my progress today.

prompt_templates.title: Archive by sender
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all emails from newsletter@example.com and move them to the Archive mailbox.

output_examples.input: Read the last 3 emails from my iCloud account
output: Email #1 - Subject: Project Update - From: colleague@icloud.com - Date: Today at 2:30 PM
Email #2 - Subject: Meeting Tomorrow - From: manager@icloud.com - Date: Today at 9:15 AM
Email #3 - Subject: Re: Question about timeline - From: client@icloud.com - Date: Yesterday at 4:45 PM

best_practices: Test scripts with visible:true before using visible:false to avoid sending emails unexpectedly
Always specify the exact account name rather than relying on email address matching
Use the osascript heredoc syntax for clean multi-line AppleScript in Claude commands
anti_patterns: Granting full disk access when only Mail access is needed
Running scripts without checking mailbox names first (INBOX vs Inbox varies by provider)
Loading full email content when only metadata is needed (significantly slower)

faq.question: Does this skill work with Gmail or Outlook?
faq.answer: No, this skill only works with Apple Mail. Use your email client's builtautomation for other clients.

faq.question: How many emails can I process at once?
faq.answer: AppleScript can handle thousands, but processing many emails with content loading is slow. Limit to 10-50 messages.

faq.question: Can I use this with other AI assistants?
faq.answer: Yes, the AppleScript examples work with any tool that can execute shell commands like osascript.

faq.question: Is my email data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. All AppleScript runs locally on your Mac through osascript. Email data never leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why does macOS prompt for permission?
faq.answer: Apple requires explicit user consent for automation and privacy protection. Grant access in System Settings > Privacy.

faq.question: How is this different from Gmail filters?
faq.answer: This provides programmatic control over Apple Mail itself. Gmail filters run on Google's servers.
